meta.title: K-12 Virtual Public School in Pennsylvania | Reach Cyber Charter School

meta.name: DESCRIPTION
meta.content: Reach Cyber Charter School is more than a tuition-free K–12 online public school option for students throughout Pennsylvania. We’re a tight-knit school community offering an award-winning curriculum, STEM programming, caring teachers, and opportunities for parent involvement.

a.title: For enrollment help, call us now at 1-844-227-0920

br.p: This website is not compatible with Internet Explorer 8 or below. Please upgrade to the latest version here. This link will open in a new window.

header.h1: K-12 Online Public School in Pennsylvania

div.p: Reach Cyber Charter School is more than a tuition-free K–12 online public school option for students throughout Pennsylvania. We’re a tight-knit school community offering an award-winning curriculum, STEM programming, caring teachers, and opportunities for parent involvement. Explore Reach Cyber!

Ready to go? Start your online
registration now!

h3.a: Important information about COVID-19 for enrolled families

br.p: Students throughout Pennsylvania are thriving at Reach Cyber Charter School, a tuition-free online public school. Reach Cyber gives students the flexibility to learn at home with a curriculum that meets rigorous state education standards.

div.p: Activities that connect online students through online enrichment
Events are great ways to learn more about online education

div.blockquote: What I like most about Reach Cyber is how much more I get to travel with my family, and also all of the STEM programs and coding.

I love my teachers at Reach Cyber because they are all friendly and really care about me as a person and a student. If I have questions, they are always quick to help me. With my teachers, I don’t feel like I’m just a face in the crowd.

img.alt: Image of Leigh Anne with a mountain in the background

div.blockquote: This is the way education should be: learning is relevant, focused, and outcome driven, with the support of caring teachers who celebrate my children’s passions and uniqueness. Our family is closer than ever, and my children are excited to be empowered in their education.

We have students who live on farms all the way to students who live in cities. It is neat to see students of different backgrounds working together and talking about their life experiences with each other.

div.p: Amanda Gaughan writes about the value of education options
70 students visit Tom Ridge Environmental Center to expand their STEM knowledge

div.h3: Students win award for their app
div.p: Students selected as winners for their app on community cleanup

ul.li: Reach Cyber is a public school academy authorized by Pennsylvania Department of Education.
Reach Cyber Charter School is accredited by the North Central Association Commission on Accreditation and School Improvement (NCA CASI), an accrediting division of Cognia, formerly AdvancED.
Reach Cyber Charter School is a Pennsylvania Connections Academy. Nearly 97% of parents parents agree that the Connections Academy curriculum is high quality. View our parent survey results.
Download the School Profile for Reach Cyber Charter School

img.alt: students standing watching a peer on a laptop

br.p: Because Reach Cyber courses are offered throughout the year—during the fall, spring, and summer sessions—our online high school provides school students in Pennsylvania three flexible learning pacing options to meet state education standards and graduate at their own pace.
br.title: Enter your title here

div.h3: Typical Number of Courses (Credits) Taken During Each Term

td.br:
Students take a full course load in the fall and spring sessions.
This option is available to students at all grade levels.

Students take fewer courses than a typical course load in the fall and spring sessions, but also attend the summer session.
This option became available in July 2017, as part of the 2017-2018 school year. It is available to students at all grade levels.

Students attend summer, fall, and spring sessions full-time, enabling them to graduate early.
This option is available to students at the high school level.

br.h2: McKinney-Vento Homeless Education Assistance Improvements Act

br.p: The McKinney-Vento Homeless Education Assistance Improvements Act of 2001 ensures educational rights and protections for children, youth, and families experiencing homelessness by removing barriers to school enrollment and daily participation in school activities. Under this act, various living situations may be considered homelessness and may qualify the child, youth, or family for certain services. To learn more about services in Pennsylvania, visit the Education for Children and Youth Experiencing Homelessness (ECYEH) Program website. If you need assistance, you can also contact the Reach Cyber Charter School homelessness liaison, Kayla Lingle, 717-219-7548 or klingle@reach.connectionsacademy.org.
